habitat_description: Though most Pluvialis fulva documented in the contiguous United States are migrants, some winter along the coast of southern California (Johnson and Connors, 2010). Here, the species can be found foraging in coastal grasslands, tidal mudflats, sandy beaches, pastures, and other grassy areas (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Cogswell, 1977; Zeiner et al., 1990; Johnson and Connors, 2010).
